dcterms:creator: Jörg Tiedemann
dcterms:description: Aymara is an Aymaran language spoken by the Aymara people of the Bolivian Andes. The data for the Aymara-Spanish comes from the Global Voices.
dcterms:title: Aymara-Spanish

dcterms:creator: Isaac Feldman
Rolando Coto-Solano
dcterms:description: The Bribri language is spoken in Southern Costa Rica. The Bribri-Spanish data came from six different sources.
dcterms:title: Bribri-Spanish

dcterms:creator: Rubén Cushimariano Romano
Richer C. Sebastián Q.
John E Ortega
Richard Castro Mamani
Kyunghyun Cho
Elena Mihas
dcterms:description: Asháninka is an Arawakan language spoken by the Asháninka people of Peru and Acre, Brazil. The parallel data for Asháninka-Spanish come mainly from three sources and translations by Richard Castro.
dcterms:title: Asháninka-Spanish

dcterms:creator: Emiliana Cruz
Anthony C Woodbury
dcterms:description: Chatino is a group of indigenous Mesoamerican languages spoken by the Chatino people in Oaxaca, Mexico. The parallel data for Chatino-Spanish can be accessed from various sources.
dcterms:title: Chatino-Spanish

dcterms:creator: Željko Agić
Ivan Vulić
Jörg Tiedemann
dcterms:description: The Quechua-Spanish data has three different sources: the Jehova’s Witnesses texts, the Peru Minister of Education, and dictionary entries and samples collected by Diego Huarcaya.
dcterms:title: Quechua-Spanish

dcterms:creator: Héctor Erasmo Gómez Montoya
Kervy Dante Rivas Rojas
Arturo Oncevay
Ana-Paula Galarreta
Andrés Melgar
dcterms:description: Shipibo-Konibo is a Panoan language spoken in the Amazon region of Peru. The data comes from three different sources: samples from flashcards, sentences translated from books for bilingual education, and dictionary entries.
dcterms:title: Shipibo-Konibo-Spanish

dcterms:creator: Gabriela Caballero
dcterms:description: Rarámuri, also known as Tarahumara, is a Uto-Aztecan language spoken in Northern Mexico. The dataset provides a description and documentation of the language.
dcterms:title: Rarámuri-Spanish

dcterms:creator: A Scott Britton
dcterms:description: Guarani is a South American language that belongs to the Tupi-Guarani family. It is one of the official languages of Paraguay and is spoken by the majority of the population.
dcterms:title: Guarani-Spanish
